string.text: Hello. Haven't seen you around here before. Where'd you come from to our midst?
I'm listening.
Hello.
Hey there, stalker.
Same as everyone else: from the Cordon.
And what brought you here, if I might ask?
Same as everyone else too: artifacts. Aren't you here for that too?

We are, fella. It wouldn't hurt for you to first look into the state of things and *then* set foot here. There are artifacts here, but not many, and stalkers pick the ones they can find in an instant — you can bet your bottom ruble that they have an eagle eye for it! I'm afraid you'll be leaving here empty-handed.
Yeah, that sucks...
I wanted to ask: have you heard about a stalker named Kite?
What's your interest in him?
He died. I'd like to find out how.
How? What happened?
He jumped from the tunnel. He had this note on him.
Not this again!
What do you mean?
Unfortunately, Kite's not the first one to do away with himself...
What might've prompted him to do it?

Who knows? Something serious was on his mind recently, as if it was torturing him. You could tell this whole Zone got under his skin. He wanted to leave. We didn't see him for a couple of days — thought he might've actually gone on out of here, but no... Shame.
His note mentioned something about a manhunt. Who's he talking about?
Really? Could I see it?
Of course.
Hm. I don't know, really — this place is full of creatures and anomalies, but I can't imagine who the note is about.
You said he wasn't the only one. Did anyone else decide to commit suicide?
Yes, but that was half a year ago. Right here in one of these village houses, Ferret shot himself. But he had his reasons — at any rate, his death wasn't as sudden as Kite's.
What might've been the reason?
He was in debt. Came here from the Garbage, where he owed a lot of money to the stalkers and trader. But was that any reason to shoot himself? That's my big question mark.
Did he happen to carry any note?
As far as I know, no.
Could I try examining the house where it happened?

No problem. If you're curious, you can go examine it, and if you get wind of anything, let me know. I'm also interested in what the hell's happening. I hope it's just a series of dumb coincidences. The house is on the outskirts of the village — we had it boarded up, 'cause going in there after what happened... no. No one's been there since what happened with Ferret.
Until next time.
I found a note where Ferret died. The wind must've blown it behind the closet, which is why you didn't find anything. Here.
God damn. What are these "five shadows"? I'm liking this less and less by the minute.
What are your thoughts on this?

Nothing. Yes, the guys had their demons, but to end their lives... it's too much. And the reason they both did it is similar. Something really must've happened to them. We need to get to the bottom of this as soon as possible.
What will we do?

We need to gather more information. Make your way to the camp and ask the stalkers thoroughly about their dead men. Maybe they'll help us with clues: where they were before their death, the places they went, and what artifacts they might've picked up — any details will help. Maybe they got caught by psy-emissions, or there's some psychic creature in the bushes that we have no idea about? We need to get to the bottom of this.\n \nIf you could help us, I'd really appreciate it. I'm not going to sit idly by either — I'll go talk to a squad of master stalkers that spend their evenings in the camp on the river bank. I'm told Kite worked for them for a while. I don't know them myself, but I hope they have some information to spare.
I understand. Let's get going, then!
Take care.
Bye.
Until next time.
See you.
Welcome to my humble establishment.
Hello! Could you tell me about something?
Is it those sudden deaths you're wondering about?
How do you know?
I'm a barman, and a good barman always knows his clients. No information from these parts has ever escaped me.
That's very good. That means you certainly ought to be able to help me.

I doubt I can. I want to, but I can't. I knew about those stalkers quite well: where they were going, what loot they got — but to talk about death... Never happened before — and when a man gets drunk, they spill their secrets faster than an emission coming at you... but not this time. So my thought is that they it wasn't entirely their doing. Someone obviously had their hand in this.
Interesting. Who, I might ask?
How am I supposed to know? If I knew, I would've helped out long ago. So you need to think — get to the bottom of this. I hope you'll manage!
Woah! My old friend! Hey there!
Opa! My old pal!
What do you want, stalker?
Speak.
I'm listening.
Why, hello, Sidorovich's lackey!
Not anymore. I'm finally done with that old man. Thanks for not ratting me out!
Anyone would've done the same. How are you doing here? Better than at the Cordon?
I'm mostly doing the same things as I did back there: going after artifacts, shooting down mutants... but at least I'm not giving anything away to Sidorovich.
How is it that you owe him?

I was bringing him some goods when the jarheads got me. Had to give those bastards everything to walk away in one piece. Then the old man says I'm not going anywhere until I work it off. Had to come up with a little plan.
And it worked! Good going.
Yeah, I got lucky there...
Hey. How are you doing?
Well, you know, had my plan to trick Sidorovich worked out, I would've been better. Maybe you know who gave me away?
No.
You asshole! Stalkers don't do that to each other. Hope you run into a boar or something.
Easy. Why are you getting mad? I just didn't want to spoil relations with Sid.
"Didn't want to spoil my relations"! Go shove your relations up your ass!
Listen, you been here for long? Do you know anything about the deaths of Kite and Ferret?
Of course I know. It's been bad news for all of us.
What do you think about it?

To be honest? All I'm thinking about is getting out of here. When you're out walking one day like always and you blow your brains out the next, that's not normal. I plan on leaving, and you better do the same.
I still have business here, so I can't. I'd also like to find out what's happening. Any idea where I should start?

I didn't know those stalkers really well, but I did hear where Kite kept some loot. Sure, it's wrong to take other people's stuff, but what good is it to them now? I was just thinking I'd grab my supplies and run away.
Where's the loot? I don't need it, but there could be useful information.
I'll mark it on your map.
Thanks. Good luck to you, and I hope we see each other again!
That's the same spot by the bridge where I visited. There's nothing there to help the investigation, but thanks anyway!
What do you want, stalker?
What do you need?
What is it?
So you're what, building a car?
Yeah, and? Gotta do something in my free time! No use going after artifacts until the next emission, and I can't just sit on my ass by the fire like those slackers, can I?
True. So where'd you get this piece of junk?
Found it here in the village, almost intact. Once I find the right parts, it won't just roll around the Zone — it'll fly!
Gonna be nice being able to haul loot, huh?
Damn right! Hah, gonna roll my way to Sidorovich with a trunk full of artifacts!
I've got a question for you: have you heard anything about the recent deaths of two stalkers?
Of course I've heard about it. Poor bastards, doing away with themselves like that.
You don't think there's a criminal element at play here?

Buddy, what "criminal element"? Ferret was deep in debt. If he hadn't done it himself, he'd be getting his due "assistance" from the mob. Kite wasn't exactly stable either, so the way I see it, it's just a coincidence. Nothing else.
Do you know who they might've hung out with before dying?
Not with me, that's for sure. Otherwise, I don't know.
Hi! Could you help me with something? Do you know anything about Kite and Ferret?
Nah. I didn't hang around with them, so I don't know.
I see. Bye.
Hey, man. Help me understand what's going on here. You know anything about the mysterious deaths of the locals?

Hey, bro. Yeah, it's a real shame about them, they were good friends to me... What's there to say, though? Ferret was all spaced-out, got into fights with him over nothing... God knows what's behind all of it. I can't tell you anything.
Thanks, stalker.
Hello. Do you know anything about the mysterious stalker deaths in the area around Novoshepelychi?
Man, I don't know anyone here. I came to the camp recently, so you're asking the wrong guy.
I understand. Bye.
What can you tell me about the deaths of the stalkers from your camp?
Leave me alone with your investigating. Go ask someone else.
Alright. Bye.
Buddy, help me. I'm trying to find out what made the stalkers from your camp take their own lives. Is there anyone who could help me?
Piss off with your questions, stalker. Not in the mood right now...
I won't bother you, then.
Hey. Who the hell are you?
What else do you want?
What is it?
I'm listening.
Hi! I'm a stalker. Just a stalker.
And what do you want, Mr. Stalker?
Ah, nothing, really.
I want to talk to you about something.
Say it.
Have you heard about a stalker named Kite?
Of course. What happened?
He's dead, and he died under the same circumstances as Ferret: of his own accord. I'm trying to figure out how they're connected and what possessed them to make that decision.

Well, that's new... I'm also interested in knowing. I understand Ferret: he was knee-deep in dept, and the bandits picked him clean too, but who knows whether that's the truth? Probably just a convenient story to cry crocodile tears to loan sharks. Kite, on the other hand... He was a decent stalker, not the reckless type. I don't believe he would've just done that...
Maybe they had some close friends that I could ask for more details?

I myself headed out with Kite a few times. Like I said, he's a reliable fellow. Not even back then did I think he'd take his life, but he started feeling miserable and I had to go after artifacts with other people.
And Ferret?
Well, that one must've always been on his own. Actually, wait... This one rookie hung around with him. What was his name?... Ah, yeah, Zarmut!
Where can I find him?
I don't know. Look in the camp. He and Ferret always used to hang out in some old shack.
Thanks. I'll ask him.
'Ey. Sit down and let's smoke, eh?
Hey, stalker.
Hello.
Hi.
I don't smoke.
So what do ya want?
Nothing, really.
I wanted to ask you something.
I'm all ears.
Say, did you know Kite and Ferret?
Our camp ain't that big — everyone knows each other. What is it you wanna know? Why they did away with themselves? I ain't got a clue.
Maybe you know where they might've been before their deaths? What they were up to?
They went after artifacts and hit the bottle in the evenings — same old, same old. Otherwise, I wasn't keeping track of their every step, so I dunno.
Did they have any close friends? Perhaps they know something?
Yeah, I don't know. One day they went with this group, next day with another. I can't point you at anyone specific.
Alright. Thanks.
Hi. Do you know anything about the recent deaths of the stalkers from your camp?
It's a shame about them... I don't know any details, though. I pretty much never left the camp back then, and right now I don't leave it at all — the things happening around here give me the creeps.
I understand. Good luck to you.
Hello. Do you know anything about the mysterious deaths of the locals?
I haven't been here for long, so I never knew the stalkers well. Sorry, not much I could tell you.
Stay safe, then.
Hey. Could you help me? I'm looking for information about the mysterious deaths of the stalkers from your camp.
Hi, stalker. No, I can't tell you anything. Only thing I know for sure is that's something's very wrong here. Don't get too involved in anything — you'll regret it!
Bye, man.
Hey. Aren't you getting tired of wandering around the camp? I have a question for you.
Hey, man. I feel better walking than sitting around chugging bottles. What is it you want to know?
Do you know anything about the deaths of the stalkers from those camps?
Oh, jeez... I'm not the guy for that freaky stuff — I know nothing. It's obvious things aren't that simple...
I gathered that much. Bye, then.
Hey. Patrolling the camp, are you? I wanted to ask you about the strange deaths of your friends from the camp.
My gut tells me you'd better not delve too deep. You'll throw yourself away like those poor bastards. I don't know anything.
Okay. Good luck, then.
Hey, man. Maybe you know something about the suicidal stalkers from your camp? What might've been wrong with them?
Hello, stalker. No, I stayed away from that mystical crap — something real spooky is going on. Leave me out of your investigation.
Good luck, then.
Hi! Zarmut, right?
Hi! What are you doing here all alone?
Yeah, that's me. Who are you?
I'm resting up here. What about you, what's your name?
I'm Axe. I wanted to ask you about your friend, named Ferret. You remember him?
Of course I remember him. But calling him my "friend"?... We were closer to being partners with a similar interest. What's your interest in it?
I want to find out what happened to him and to Kite. Will you tell me what happened to Ferret on the days leading up to his death?

Usual stuff. We'd wake up in the morning and go after loot. He was like a mentor to me — taught me everything. I'm of the sort that's never even been to the Cordon — came here immediately. I had no clue about to survive here and the laws that reign here. He told me everything, showed me everything. I paid him by being like, uh... cannon fodder for him. Brought him grub and went first into anomalies. That's how we did things for a few months.\n \nAfter that, he fell into a depression, out of nowhere. I'd wake him up at sunrise and say, "Let's go find some loot." He'd tell me, "No, I'm not going. Let me have some sleep." I was thinking, is this Ferret I'm talking to? He'd do anything for money — doesn't let a single artifact out of his sight — and now he's refusing to go find loot. That was my second day sitting in the camp like that, and there he was: moping, not talking to anyone, all shaken-up, hood over his head. Locked himself in the house and sat there. To my knowledge, he didn't even drink.
What happened next?
I freaked out on him and went on a trip with other stalkers. ??? Went back to visit the guy, and then I saw his brains splattered on the wall. That's what happened.
Do you remember what happened the day before?
Nothing out of the ordinary. I remember they brought two Jellyfish near the bridge. Spent the whole evening there and came back at dusk.
Did they come across any mutants?
A couple of boars and dogs. How so?
Nothing. I just wanted to ask in case they met a controller or a poltergeist or something. He couldn't have fallen into that state without a reason...
No, they didn't come across anything like that. They don't inhabit these parts anyway.
Alright, thanks for the info, even if I didn't find out anything new.
If you do learn anything, be sure to let me know. I'm also interested.
Alright.
Hey, wait, listen: I told you everything. While you're still here, would you mind joining me for a drink? A drink to our boys' memory. What do you say?
I've got nowhere else to go. Pour it.
Not bad, huh?
Not at all! Gimme just a little bit more. No, wait... Damn, this vodka of yours got me hammered again... Shi-i-i...
You alright? Want another one?
Yeah. Cheers!
What brings you here?
Hello, stalker.
What are you after?
What do you want?
Spill it.
Another one here for the party.
What happened? Why's everyone gathered here?
Come in, see for yourself.
So, what do you think?
You sure you're asking the right guy? I really don't know anything anymore.

Exactly. I get those two... but Eustace? No way he could've done it on his own. I'm sure — everyone's sure — that there's something damn wrong here. Screw this place: we're getting out of here tomorrow, or even today! Did you find anything out? Eustace told us you took up investigating all that's happening.
Practically nothing... except... Listen, what do you know about the stalkers by the bridge? They camp there during the evenings, on the river bank.
What stalkers? Everyone who's here is in this camp. There are the hunters too, but they have their base in the woods.
Kite worked for them shortly before his death, and Ferret passed that place with his partner. Eustace visited them too — tried to get information. See a connection?
I don't know. I haven't heard anything about that stalker squad. We've been here for some time, so we'd know about them for sure.
We'll look into it. I'll go scout that territory at sunset. Will you back me up if worst comes to worst?
Of course! Just give us a call and we'll rush over.
Great. I'll be in touch.
Hey, what do you think you're doing?!
I... I... I don't know. What's happening? What am I doing?

That's what I'm asking you! What are you doing on top of the bridge? Don't tell me you were thinking of jumping, buddy... This is the Zone: there are enough folks dying here as it is, so trust me when I say you don't want to join their ranks.
I didn't mean to do it! My head's not feeling right. I don't get anything.
Just climb down from there, nice and easy.
Okay...
Until next time.
See you.
I'll be going.
Hello.
Hi, stalker.
Hello there.
Can we talk now?
Yeah, I'm fine. I have no idea how I got up there. Thank you... If it wasn't for you, I'd be in pieces from the anomaly under the bridge.
We'll even up, stalker. I'd rather you tell me what made you do it?

I came to these parts on a job, and I chose to help the stalkers find out why their people are dying... by their own hand, it seems. Something's very much not right, so an interest grew in me — not just an interest, of course, but I digress. I thought it had something to do with the stalkers that make camp by the fire. I went to talk to them, and then... they disappeared out of nowhere. Then some crazy stuff happened: I heard whispers and saw silhouettes on the river...
You sure you haven't had too much to drink?
I saw it with my own eyes — cross my heart!
Alright. I do believe you... because I've seen it myself.
Seriously? Just what is that crap?

I'll be honest with you: I've been trying to get to the bottom of it myself for quite some time. I found something out, and I believe we can shed some light on this if we do it together. How's that sound?
I owe you my life... in a good sense of the word, of course.

Oh, please. Now, here's what I've gathered: those five stalkers have actually been dead for a long time. Their spirits, however, are uneasy, and they still inhabit these parts. If we give them what they want, they'll leave the local stalkers in peace.
So what is it that they want?
Justice. They were killed — killed for profit. The man behind it all is currently in the camp in the abandoned village.
Is that why stalkers are dying there?
It would seem so. The village is cursed, and anyone who occupies it is cursed along with it, hence why I don't even go there. As you can see, I'm still alive.
So we need to give the spirits what they want: the perpetrator!
Correct.
How do we find him?
If only I knew...
There are about ten of them there. Might be hard to sniff him out.

One of the deceased was my friend. Shortly before his death, he sent me a distress signal. As I was rushing to help him, he said he didn't know who attacked them... only that the attacker reeked of motor oil.
Huh. I'll make my way to the camp and try to find out about that. Where do I find you later?
We'll keep in touch. If needed, I'll find you myself.
Okay.
Mind if I ask you some more questions?
Sure. I'll tell you what I know.
Why did stalkers appear the above water? That gave me the chills...

As far as I can tell, the blood of the stalkers became one with the river. In the end, it helped them find peace and punish those responsible for everything. Could it be an anomaly, or something else?... I don't know. The Zone's not just a contaminated area but, seemingly, an organism living its own life. Understanding it is a difficult thing to do. I'm afraid no one can give you a certain answer to your question...
How's your car repair going?
Hey. Fixing the car, are you? Any luck with it?
Not really. If it'll roll anywhere, it's to the nearest landfill with a kick.
Cheer up. I've got some good news for you.
What news?

There's a scientist group nearby that bit the dust. They've already been looted by some stalkers, but there's a car that's almost fully intact. I thought I'd tell you so you could scrounge it for parts.
You for real? Could you show me where? I'll let you be the first to drive this baby in return.
Yeah, no problem. Got nothing to do anyway.
What's going on here? Where's the ride?
Don't know. Maybe it got stolen?
What are you talking about, god dammit? Who'd steal it around here?
Burers, maybe...
Is that it?
That's that. You wimp — you didn't even have to do anything! I did all the work myself!
I don't have a good feeling about it. What if someone finds out? We probably shouldn't have done that.
Who's gonna find out? Those were just a few random drifters — they weren't from our camp. Now, thanks to them, you and I are packed with loot.
Shall we get out of here, then? I don't like this place one bit!
Uhuh. Let's go — you first.
Hi there.
Was that it?
Yep. Thanks, stalker! You did a good thing.
I hope there won't be a threat to anyone anymore?
No, everything will be fine now — I'm sure. There is, however, one more thing that needs to be done.
What is it?
Those poor stalkers deserve a burial. Better late than never.
Yeah. I suppose that'll be the right thing. It's a shame about them... people will do anything for a slice of the cake these days.

You're right. We're so set on money that we stop thinking about life itself, and all the choices in life we've made dawn on us in the end, seconds before death. That's the saddest part... Now, let's give those stalkers a proper burial. There's an old shovel lying over there.
Yeah, alright.
Don't forget me too...
What?
Hey, stalker! What's that thing you're playing with in the bushes? C'mon, give it here.
Hey, guys, what do you want with it? Don't touch it!
How do we know what it is? What if it's some expensive machinery, or even a bomb? We've been in these woods a long time, and we want to keep things nice and quiet.
Who are you?
Hunters. Ever heard of 'em?
No.
Yeah, I've heard something...

Well, that's us. We hunt here and make a living, and we don't need no strangers with their knickknacks here. So, if you want your little device back, talk to the man in charge, Jug. He'll decide what to do with it. Let's go — I'll lead you there.
Got nowhere else to go anyway...
Welcome. Who might you be?
Just a regular stalker. I go by Axe.
A regular stalker wouldn't run around the woods with a bunch of devices.
I'm just a stalker doing some work for the scientists. They asked me to set up scanners to research the anomalous behavior in this area.

A scanner, huh? We'll see, we'll see. Our technician will take a look at it, and if what you're saying is true, don't worry: we'll give it back. And don't you be afraid of us — you're no mutant, are you? If you were, you'd be hanging on my wall and I'd have sold your mane.
I see there's not much room left on the wall... So you hunt down mutants in these woods?

You could say that. As soon as all this stuff started popping up in the Zone — anomalies, artifacts, mutants — the boys and I made a move to this place. But we didn't care about any of that. No, we were interested in the local wildlife. On the outside, there's no way you can go hunting like here: kill the wrong animal and bam, you're a poacher. Here, the amount of wild animals is by no means smaller, and what you get for shooting them down aren't handcuffs around your wrists but gratitude and even some payment.
There are quite a lot of you here.

Many of these people came here only after we set up camp in these woods. Just like you, they wandered around in search of artifacts, but then stayed behind. Stalkers have a greedy nature, and stuffed animals can get you a lot of money — no less than those artifacts of yours. Want to try? We could always use an extra pair of hands.
Me? My last hunt didn't go so well. Could say I was the one being hunted...
Don't you worry your head about it — the boys will cover you if anything happens. Zakhar — one of us who's been here since day one — is going out to shoot some boars.
Why not?
Great. Go talk to him — he's outside by the fire.
Alright.
Talk to Zakhar. You'll get the scanner after the hunt.
Go see Zakhar. I'll see what's what with your device.
Go out hunting with Zakhar. I'll see what kind of device you tried to plant here.
Are you Zakhar? I was told I could go hunting with you.
Feeling nervous? Ease up, it'll be fine. Yeah, I wouldn't mind a helper — my boys are out doing other stuff, so it's just me and Amur here.
Amur?
Amur's my dog! Don't worry — he doesn't bite. He's not from Chornobyl or anywhere nearby.
What do we need to do?
What we always do: we go deep inside the woods, track and shoot down boars. Then you cover me while I cut off their hooves.
Who needs those hooves anyway?

What a question! The scientists pay handsomely for them. Don't know what they do with them afterwards, though... You work with the scientists — you must've seen how many soldiers there are in that facility. Gotta feed them somehow.
Ew.
I'm only joking. Sometimes, though, it's to drool for... Okay, time's a-wastin'. Let's go.

I'm only joking. Sometimes, though, it's to drool for... Just one thing: it's getting dark, and going into the woods at night is quite dangerous. Go rest up in our camp if you want, and then in the morning we can head off. Your shotgun will useful in the hunt, so don't put it away anywhere.

I'm only joking. Sometimes, though, it's to drool for... Just one thing: you should get a hold of a shotgun. Your stalker peashooters have no place in the woods. You might be able to find something in the military base, so check there. If you find anything, come back at daytime — hunting in the dark is a surefire way to get killed.

I'm only joking. Sometimes, though, it's to drool for... Just one thing: it's getting dark, and going into the woods at night is quite dangerous. Go rest up in our camp if you want, and then in the morning we can head off.\n \nAnd get yourself a shotgun of some sort — your stalker peashooters have no place in the woods. You might be able to find something in the military base, so check there.
Let's move.
Agreed.
So, ready to hunt?
You ready to kick some mutant ass?
Come by at sunrise.
Drop by at morning and we'll start the hunt.
What are you going to shoot with? Get a decent shotgun!
You should start with the tools of the trade. Find yourself a shotgun!
Come by when it's bright, and don't forget a shotgun!
We're not going anywhere at nighttime — come back in the morning. And don't forget a shotgun. It'll be tough without it.
Let's get 'em!
Let's blast those things!
I'll come by another time.
I'll come back later.
Alright.
Sure.
Finally! It wasn't easy finding you!
What are *you* doing here?
I came here to warn you. You shouldn't trust Dubinin! Do not give the transmuted artifact to him or to his cutthroats! And you should get as far away from here as possible.
I don't understand. Why did the scientist expedition sent by Dubinin start opening fire without warning?

Those are no scientists — have you not understood yet? I don't know who they are, but I know for a fact that you were used by them for nothing. They needed an experience stalker — such as you — who would carry through their artifact selection plan. You did your job, and now they're attempting to get rid of any witnesses.\n \nAs soon as I found out, I hurried here to find and warn you. I owe you after what happened in the swamp, and if it weren't for you, I'd be rotting in the reeds with those stalkers.
You're a bit late on that...
I didn't know how to contact you remotely. The only way for me was to find you in person.
So why should I trust you? You work with Dubinin.

I worked with him... but I had no idea I wasn't working for science. By pure chance, I overheard him speaking — I don't know who Dubinin contacted, but they had the goal of retrieving the artifact and eliminating all witnesses. I believe that would've included me. As soon as I learned everything, I made my way here.
What do I do now?

You need to hide for some time. As for the artifact... hide it somewhere else. I will give you a shielded container — the safest option would be to place the artifact inside and bury it somewhere. I do hope that my superiors in the scientific institute will receive my message and arrest Dubinin, but in the meantime, you must leave.
I appreciate it. I don't know how to thank you enough.
I hope all of this will end and you will have the opportunity of doing that.
I'll be seeing you, then!
Hurry!
It's dangerous here. Leave now!
You shouldn't idle here. Leave!
Take care.
I'll be gone in a moment.
Until next time.
God damn!
You're bleeding!
I ain't got time to bleed. That thing is here again! Did you see him?
Who? You mean the boar? Of course I saw it!
"The boar"... Not just any boar, but General Shtok! We've given that bastard a whole identity after trying to hunt him down for half a year.
General Shtok?

Did you see him? Built like a tank and weighing in at least six hundred pounds. You can't track him down either — he's the one who finds us when we least want it. Kolyan, one of us, is still lying with a broken leg — lucky he wasn't bitten to death — whereas others have gone missing. Must be the work of that prick boar!
We need to go back to the camp. You're gushing blood.
Telling you, it's just a scratch... Let's go.
Get up.
Aren't *you* hurt?
No, I'm fine. How's Zakhar?
He'll live — it's not his first time. Thank you for covering him. By the way, I looked at your scanner, and it seems it really does scan anomaly zones. You can have it back.
Great.

So, stalker, I can see you're no slouch. I asked my friends from the Cordon, and they've only had good things to say about you. If you need work or you have hooves and tails you wanna spare, bring it to us and we'll hand you some supplies.
I'll keep that in mind. Good luck to you!
We ran into this huge boar in th woods...

General Shtok. Yeah, he's even got a name. Elusive bastard! You think you know every little shrub in these woods, but you can never find where he's hiding. Our entire group tried tracking him down for two months when Kolyan almost got eaten alive by him. We followed the trail, but it's like he vanished into thin air. That's how he got his name, for his size and his mind. My dream is for his ugly face to hang on my wall.
Zakhar wounded him, and he might've left traces. Maybe we should do another search?

Two of us are lying in the infirmary and several others have gone missing. I can't afford sending anyone else to catch him. Once our boys get back from Agroprom, I'll gather a new team, but until then, we'll be extra careful in these woods. And you too — keep your eyes peeled.
What if I try tracking him down? I've dealt with unusual mutants before, and I'm dying to find out what kind of predator that is.
I see... Alright, man, bye.
You serious?
I'll try and see what happens.
Actually, I'd rather not...
If you really want to, I'm not gonna hold you back. Your reward will be handsome if it works out.
I'm off, then.
Hey, about your Shtok: what if I try to trace him and bring him down?
We'd very much appreciate it, stalker. Are you sure?
Yes. I'll try.
I'll give it some thought.
Then good luck to you. I suggest you examine the area where he toppled Zakhar — he told me the two of you wounded that boar. Look for any trails of blood and something might come out of it.
I'll try.
I have some good news and bad news.
Really, now? Spit it!
I found the partially eaten corpse of one of your missing men, Grek. Here's his PDA and his last entries.
Grek... Shit. He was always the first to rush into hunts, and really helped us with getting settled here. Where'd you find him?
Here's where the good news come in: I found him in Shtok's lair. It's in a hidden hole in the woods.
You saw him?
I killed him. The carcass is in a small cave behind the swamp. You can go have his head... or anything else.

Woah, that's great news! I won't let you down on the reward either! Look here: this gun is the best you could have for shooting down the local vermin! It's all upgraded — I'm sure you'll like it. I'll also give you a couple of ammo boxes. Will that do?
This'll be mighty useful. Thanks!
If you want more work, come by. We'll always have it for you!
I might come visit your woods again, as long as you don't take my stuff. Good luck!
Stop tormenting that guitar, will you?
Mind your own business! I'll have you know you're talking to an educated musician.
Educated? How many bricks did your neighbors throw in your window to get you to stop? That must be why you're in the Zone in the first place!
Look at the joker! What are you getting under my skin for? My guitar was broken, you understand? That's why it sounds like that. It died in battle...
What happened?

Me and my pal were heading back to camp when those lowlives decided to gang up on us and grab our loot. We flatly refused — what, was I poking around in anomalies all day for nothing? "Up yours," I told 'em. And then it started. Didn't hesitate a moment to show them their place — shot one in the shoulder, and they all ran away. Then I look and see a hole in my guitar, and the tuning pegs were hit too! Couldn't believe it: I was inches away from taking a bullet myself! *I* made it out in one piece, but my guitar's dead and done... What am I gonna do without it?
That's sad. I think I'll be spending more time in the local village, so I'll ask the locals if they have any guitar. Can't promise anything, though.
A sad story. I can only wish you good luck in finding a new guitar.
I've got some good news for you: I was in the local village and found this new guitar. I've no use for it, so take it. Is it playable?
Seriously? Thanks, bud!
Yeah, thanks for nothing. Bye.
Wow, thanks a whole lot, man! Couldn't have come here at a better time! I'll try it out — doesn't even look like it's seen any use!
Don't thank me just yet. If I find it, you'll play me something!
Good luck to you.
Don't thank me yet. Try playing something.
God damn... What is it stalker? Got something?
What is it?
What do ya want?
What a life... Oh, hey, man. What do you want?
I'm just dying to play something...
Glad to see you!
Want to hear anything, stalker?
Hey there!
Hi, stalker.
Hey, stalker. Want me to play?
So, you still remember how to play the guitar? Here!
For real? Thanks a ton!
Put it to the test!
By some miracle, I found this guitar in the village nearby. Go ahead, give it a try.
Really? Wow, thanks a ton, pal!
Try it out first!
Hey, bro! Got a little favor to ask. Could you help?
Hey, boys. You're from Freedom, right? What a surprise. I hope you're friendlier than the last bunch I met. What can I help you with?

Our squad is one of the last in Freedom. Clan's dying out... Basically, we need a long-term shelter that won't stick out. The nearby oil depot seems like just the right place, but there are at least a dozen bandies there. We can't risk taking them on by ourselves, but with your help, it'll be a different story.
What's in it for me? In fact, why me at all?

Don't worry about that, bro; we'll make it up to you. Besides, you're not the only one we've asked — there's a stalker sitting at the crossing with a broken guitar, and he's having a hell of a hard time playing it. Says the bandits beat it up, but he doesn't have the guts to get payback. Can't ask anyone else around here — they like just sitting in their camps. Are you up for it?
When are we moving?
You'll do just fine without me. Find somebody else if you need to.
We'll wait until night. Me and the boys already have info on the sentries' positions. First we take out the scum at the entrance, and after that, it shouldn't be hard to take down the rest.
I thought better of you. Well, safe travels.
Deal.
Bye.
Yeah? What is it?
I'll help you with the bandits. Still set on the oil depot?
Nothing.

I knew you were a real dog! Alright, we'll wait until night. Me and the boys already have info on how the sentries are positioned. First, we'll take out the scum at the entrance, and after that, it shouldn't be hard to take down the rest.
Sounds good to me.
We sure showed them! I've had more interesting gunfights, but that one'll do. Why are you giving me that look?
Come on... You know what I want.

Okay, sure, sure. You can have my gun. I got it not long ago, so it's almost like new — I'll stick to a simpler piece myself. Here's some money on top of that. Go to the village, have a drink with the stalkers.
Now we're talking. What's your next step?
We'll start settling down. There's not much behind these walls, but at least we feel safe. We'll reach out to you if we need any more help, man... In the meantime, lemme rest for a while.
Bye.
What's up, stalker?
Ey, bro.
What's new?
What do you need, fresh meat?
What?
Looking for something here?
Bro, got a little job for you. Since you helped us with the bandits, help us with another problem.
Tell me what's up.
Holy...! Listen, I've never even dealt with a chimera. What am I risking my life for?
You weren't disappointed with the reward last time, were you? This one is even better.
Bro, you the one who did the bandits in? We get here and their bodies are all laid out!
Ran into those parasites while I was in the area, so I did some cleaning.
Okay, okay, hotshot. Either way, you deserve a reward for that!
Thanks for that. What did you want to tell me?
Holy...! Listen, I've never even dealt with a chimera. Why would I get myself into that?
The reward's worth it, stalker. You have Freedom's word.
Bro, got a little job for you. We dealt with the bandits ourselves, but this thing? Can't do it without a stalker.
What is it?
Things just got real! Never dealt with a chimera before. Why should I sign up for this?
You'll like the reward, stalker. Just help us deal with the mutant — we won't be sleeping the nights while it's still around.

There's a chimera not far from here: one of the scariest things you'll see in the Zone. Even the local hunters won't make a move on it. They themselves live far enough away, so it's no concern of theirs... but that thing is right at our doorstep, so we thought we'd ask you help deal with it. For things like this, you need every man you can get.
I need to give it some thought and prepare. I'll let you know if I'll join the hunt.
Alright. Just don't keep us waiting.
See you.
Bro, decide already. Ready to go hunt the chimera?
Ready. When are we moving?
Not ready yet.
In the dark. Chimera only hunts at at night; at daytime, it hides somewhere, apparently.
Let's do this.
How you holding up? Seems to me your legs are shaking!
Scary thing. Not everyone could take it on one-on-one.

Whatever, it's all behind us. Here's for the help, like I promised. We're heading back, so stop by if you get the chance. Just so you know, I can repair your stuff if need be, and not for the insane local prices either!
I'll keep that in mind. Thanks! Later, boys.
Bartender, do you know where I could find a guitar around here?
One of our boys likes to play at times. Can hear him from here — not sure who it is. A terrible player, to be honest, but let's keep that between us.
Thanks.
Sorry to interrupt, but do you know where I'd find a guitar around here?
Huh? A guitar? Not my concern. Go ask the others.
I mean, maybe someone likes playing around here. Know anything?
Don't know, so I can't tell you. Don't waste my time.
Bye.
Stalker, you know if there's an extra guitar around here?
Couldn't have asked at a better time! I just took it away from our local drunkard — guy was making a ruckus with his friend, and he doesn't even know how to play.
Can I take it?
Be my guest!
You don't have it with you? Where'd you put it?
Easier if I mark it on your map. Here are your coordinates. Off you go.
Thanks, man!
Save your thanks. I hope the instrument finds good hands now.
Bye!
Someone play the guitar here? I need an instrument bad.
Yeah, people play sometimes. Some people come, some people go, so I don't really know. Go see the people at our bar and maybe you'll find something.
Thank you.
Stalker, got an extra guitar laying around in the village?
We have one; our stalkers like playing it. I think we have several of them, even, so your chances aren't low. Can't tell you anything else.
That's good. I'll keep looking.
Listen, don't suppose you have an extra guitar in the village?
Best you ask the folks at the bar about that.
Got it. Thanks.
Hey! Can I find a guitar anywhere around here?
Hey, man. No, I haven't been here for long and don't plan to, so I'm not your guy.
Okay. I'll ask the others.
Stalker, know where I could find an extra guitar in the village?
For sure! Someone was even talking recently that he found a guitar and planned on playing it. If he hasn't done it yet, you could try finding the instrument.
I see. Well, thanks.
Hey, any chance I could find a guitar in the village? Know if anyone here plays it?
Well, I play it myself sometimes when my buddy gets here from the Cordon. He took it last time, though.
Know if any of the locals play?
One of them was playing it. Don't remember who — not a local myself. Go and ask around.
Thanks.
Got an extra guitar in the village, stalker?
Off with you, fresh meat. I'm relaxing.
Sure thing.
Stalker, can I get my hands on a guitar here?
No idea. Go ask around on the street.
Bye.
Hey, man. Know if anyone here has a guitar they don't need?
Why would anyone give their guitar to you? Good luck finding a patron, hah!
Bye.
Hey! Anywhere I can find a guitar in the vilage?
What are you asking me for? Go ask the others.
You're a tight-lipped one. Bye.
Hey, stalker. Don't happen to know where there's a guitar around here?
A guitar, huh? Go shove it up somewhere if you find it. I'm busy.
Easy, easy. Won't bother you.
Hey, can I find a guitar around here?
No, you can't. Go away.
Noted...
Man, you watch over the village like a bird. Help me out: where can I get a guitar here?

Hm, well... we do have a "musician" nearby. His name's Dimka Gozinak. He and his friend had a bit too much liquor and played so the whole village heard. There's a small-time trader close to them; try asking him. It ended when he took away the guitar from those drunk bastards.
Thanks for the tip.
Hey, where can I find a guitar around here?
Ask the boys in the village. I don't know anything about that.
Got it.
Is anyone but you interested in stuffed monsters?

Some rich people like to put them in their mansion, and then boast to the same pompous guests that he himself was in the Chernobyl Zone, and with his own hands killed this dangerous beast! In short, for show. Well, this is just one example, of course. In fact, people buy them for different purposes. Some for aesthetics, some even for scientific purposes.
Tell us more about your group.

As you've probably realised by now, our main trade is hunting. From those monster carcasses that were not particularly damaged during the killing, we make stuffed animals. Sometimes we get orders for biological material from scientists. Meat to eat.
What, do you eat monster meat straight?

The boar meat here tastes just as good as the one on the Big Land. No one's died yet, at least. But we're not going to eat Burers, Cats, Isloms, and other things that have mutated inexplicably where and how, of course.
And the guys with you, who are they?

We met many of them back on the Big Land. We went hunting together, even though we lived in different regions. We gathered every summer in the taiga and allowed ourselves a whole month of free life in nature. And as soon as they learned about the Zone, their eyes lit up to try their hand in these parts. That's how we settled here. And Knyaz, who brought you here to me, is my oldest bro. We've known each other since we were students. We went to restoration college together. That's where the skills of making stuffed animals come from.
I take it I can trade with you?

You got that right. If you've got any monster parts, dump them out, I'll buy them. No one in the Zone will pay you more than us for it. But I'm telling you straight away: don't bring me any rotten stuff, guts and arseholes! But I see you're not a stupid guy, and you won't cut such things yourself.
Tell me about yourself.

Before the Zone, I lived in Astrakhan. He fished, salted fish, sold watermelons. Like a stereotypical, typical Astrakhan resident! And then when he learnt about the Zone, he immediately got the idea to visit it. My wife refused to understand it, so we had a fight with her... And fuck her, I'm happy here and I don't regret anything! I've got something better than my wife here, hah! Understand? You don't get it? All right, well.
Tell me about yourself.

If you're really that interested, sit down, I'll tell you. So, before I was in the Zone, I lived in Yelan City. You probably don't even know where that is, but fuck it. That's not the point. I loved hunting and fishing very much, but because of our modern laws, you can't do it to the fullest. All these licences, permits, commissions, inspections... Bureaucracy, in short! And when rumours about the Zone started spreading, I jumped into an UAZ truck with my men and came here! It's a hunter's paradise! So many wild places, lawlessness, complete freedom of choice, how and what to kill animals with! Don't look at me like that, I'm not a killer. They are monsters that must be exterminated to secure the outside world and at the same time, to enrich our pockets. So here we are: we arrived in the Zone, we decided not to linger on Cordon. We immediately set off to this area, because we knew that it was the most remote. The wild Chernobyl nature in its purest form! And, indeed, when we reached the place and set up camp, there was not a soul around! Stalker's foot had not yet set foot here. It was later that all sorts of artefact seekers, loners, bandits came here. That's how it is.
What's wrong with you? You look worried!
Look at them! Look at those faces! They may be dead, but they scare the hell out of me!
Who?
Who, who? Are you blind? There, the scarecrows in front of me!
Stuffed animals, to hell with them...
It's like they're alive. At night I've noticed them moving, even making sounds. It's like they're coming to life! There's something unclean going on here...
I think you're just tired of living here. Why don't you go to the local bar in Novoshepelichi, take your mind off it for a day? You'll go wild in the woods thinking like that.
I can't get out of here. I've got to keep an eye on these scarecrows and be on the lookout! They could come back to life at any moment!
Tell me about yourself.

This hunting camp you're in now is my and Gorshok's brainchild! But I didn't like hunting at all before... When I was still at school, I crossed paths with Gorshok, and he got me thoroughly hooked on it! At first we just went duck hunting as amateurs. Then we organised a local club. They called it the Office. And then almost the whole bunch came here. The men, though, got too involved. You can't do that. They sold their flats on the Big Land, divorced their wives. Some of them even forgot that they actually have children, parents... I try to go home once every two or three months. To see my family, to give them some money. But everyone has his own life. Whoever wants to do what he wants, let him do what he wants to do.
Tell me a little about yourself.
Go ask the guys. I'm not in the mood to talk today.
